column2: Identifier - fales_io_print000001, bobst_io_print000002 or similar (don't duplicate numbers)

column16: Commemorates an Askari (Eritrian) battalion in the Italian army. Includes a list of major engagements and a listing of Italian officers.
Askari (Eritrean) soldier in the Italian army carrying a rifle next to a lion. Includes dates of Bronze Medals awarded to the battalion.
Two Askari (Eritrean) soldiers holding the battalion flag.
Battle fought by Askari (Eritrean) soldiers at Zuetina, Libya on March 12, 1914.

column1: Battaglione "Roma"- XIII Askari Eritrei (13° Battaglione Eritreo)-  Askari waving flag with SPQR wolf statue in background + desert
column16: Askari (Eritrean) waving a flag with an SQPR ("The Senate and the Roman People") wolf statue in the background. Postmarked with address and handwritten correspondence on back.

column1: R°. Corpo di Truppe Coloniali- Eritrea- Compagnia Cannonieri

column16: Askari (Eritrean) soldier with a rifle and a battalion flag. The motto of the battalion is written in Latin ("All the Bold Light") with the drawing of a lion with a knife in his mouth. The back list the engagements of the battalion: Caserma Turca (8/5/1925); Uadi Gantar (11/6/1925); Uadi Aisilau (5/25/1926)' and Uadi El Cuf Gereieb (7/7/1926)

Askari (Eritrean) battalion climbing a hill toward battle. The reverse side Includes a quote noting the soldiers "resolution, courage, and loyalty" to the King in the battles of Misurata, Suani ben Adem, El Mergheb, Sidi se Sakiah, Fondue Scebani (1/28 through 6/22, 1922)
